quote_first: That Sunday was a picture-book summer day in Maine: clear, bright, warm. At
quote_last: , Ruth McCausland, dressed in a pretty blue summer frock, left her house for the last time.
title: The Tommyknockers
author: Stephen King

quote_first: The boy handed in a dispatch. The Professor closed the door again, and after looking at the direction, opened it and read aloud. “Look out for D. He has just now,
quote_last: , come from Carfax hurriedly and hastened towards the South. He seems to be going the round and may want to see you: Mina"
title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker

quote_first: Because it was raining, and because she was depressed and out of sorts, and because Robbie had not come by
quote_last: , Elizabeth treated herself to a Martini while she was waiting, sitting uncomfortably on a narrow chair in the restaurant, watching other unimpressive people go in and out.
title: The Lottery, or the Adventure of James Harris
author: Shirley Jackson
